jobName.Description: The name of the batch inference job to create.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version that will be used to generate the batch inference recommendations.

filterArn.Description: The ARN of the filter to apply to the batch inference job. For more information on using filters, see Filtering batch recommendations .

numResults.Description: The number of recommendations to retrieve.

jobInput.Description: The Amazon S3 path that leads to the input file to base your recommendations on. The input material must be in JSON format.

jobOutput.Description: The path to the Amazon S3 bucket where the job's output will be stored.

roleArn.Description: The ARN of the Amazon Identity and Access Management role that has permissions to read and write to your input and output Amazon S3 buckets respectively.

batchInferenceJobConfig.Description: The configuration details of a batch inference job.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the batch inference job.

jobName.Description: The name of the batch segment job to create.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version you want the batch segment job to use to generate batch segments.

filterArn.Description: The ARN of the filter to apply to the batch segment job. For more information on using filters, see Filtering batch recommendations .

numResults.Description: The number of predicted users generated by the batch segment job for each line of input data.

jobInput.Description: The Amazon S3 path for the input data used to generate the batch segment job.

jobOutput.Description: The Amazon S3 path for the bucket where the job's output will be stored.

roleArn.Description: The ARN of the Amazon Identity and Access Management role that has permissions to read and write to your input and output Amazon S3 buckets respectively.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the batch segment job.

name.Description: A name for the new campaign. The campaign name must be unique within your account.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version to deploy.

minProvisionedTPS.Description: Specifies the requested minimum provisioned transactions (recommendations) per second that Amazon Personalize will support.

campaignConfig.Description: The configuration details of a campaign.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the campaign.

schemaArn.Description: The ARN of the schema to associate with the dataset. The schema defines the dataset fields.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group to add the dataset to.

datasetType.Description:
The type of dataset.
One of the following (case insensitive) values:

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the dataset.

jobName.Description: The name for the dataset export job.

datasetArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset that contains the data to export.

ingestionMode.Description: The data to export, based on how you imported the data. You can choose to export only BULK data that you imported using a dataset import job, only PUT data that you imported incrementally (using the console, PutEvents, PutUsers and PutItems operations), or ALL for both types. The default value is PUT .

roleArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that has permissions to add data to your output Amazon S3 bucket.

jobOutput.Description: The path to the Amazon S3 bucket where the job's output is stored.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the dataset export job.

name.Description: The name for the new dataset group.

roleArn.Description: The ARN of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that has permissions to access the Key Management Service (KMS) key. Supplying an IAM role is only valid when also specifying a KMS key.

kmsKeyArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Key Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt the datasets.

domain.Description: The domain of the dataset group. Specify a domain to create a Domain dataset group. The domain you specify determines the default schemas for datasets and the use cases available for recommenders. If you don't specify a domain, you create a Custom dataset group with solution versions that you deploy with a campaign.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the dataset group.

jobName.Description: The name for the dataset import job.

datasetArn.Description: The ARN of the dataset that receives the imported data.

dataSource.Description: The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the training data to import.

roleArn.Description: The ARN of the IAM role that has permissions to read from the Amazon S3 data source.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the dataset import job.

importMode.Description: Specify how to add the new records to an existing dataset. The default import mode is FULL. If you haven't imported bulk records into the dataset previously, you can only specify FULL .

name.Description: The name for the event tracker.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group that receives the event data.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the event tracker.

name.Description: The name of the filter to create.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The ARN of the dataset group that the filter will belong to.

filterExpression.Description: The filter expression defines which items are included or excluded from recommendations. Filter expression must follow specific format rules. For information about filter expression structure and syntax, see Filter expressions .

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the filter.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination domain dataset group for the recommender.

recipeArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recipe that the recommender will use. For a recommender, a recipe is a Domain dataset group use case. Only Domain dataset group use cases can be used to create a recommender. For information about use cases see Choosing recommender use cases .

recommenderConfig.Description: The configuration details of the recommender.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the recommender.

schema.Description: A schema in Avro JSON format.

domain.Description: The domain for the schema. If you are creating a schema for a dataset in a Domain dataset group, specify the domain you chose when you created the Domain dataset group.

performHPO.Description:
Whether to perform hyperparameter optimization (HPO) on the specified or selected recipe. The default is false .
When performing AutoML, this parameter is always true and you should not set it to false .

performAutoML.Description:
Whether to perform automated machine learning (AutoML). The default is false. For this case, you must specify recipeArn .
When set to true, Amazon Personalize analyzes your training data and selects the optimal USER_PERSONALIZATION recipe and hyperparameters. In this case, you must omit recipeArn. Amazon Personalize determines the optimal recipe by running tests with different values for the hyperparameters. AutoML lengthens the training process as compared to selecting a specific recipe.

recipeArn.Description: The ARN of the recipe to use for model training. Only specified when performAutoML is false.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group that provides the training data.

eventType.Description:
When your have multiple event types (using an EVENT_TYPE schema field), this parameter specifies which event type (for example, 'click' or 'like') is used for training the model.
If you do not provide an eventType, Amazon Personalize will use all interactions for training with equal weight regardless of type.

solutionConfig.Description: The configuration to use with the solution. When performAutoML is set to true, Amazon Personalize only evaluates the autoMLConfig section of the solution configuration.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the solution.

solutionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution containing the training configuration information.

trainingMode.Description: The scope of training to be performed when creating the solution version. The FULL option trains the solution version based on the entirety of the input solution's training data, while the UPDATE option processes only the data that has changed in comparison to the input solution. Choose UPDATE when you want to incrementally update your solution version instead of creating an entirely new one.

tags.Description: A list of tags to apply to the solution version.

campaignArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to delete.

datasetArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset to delete.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The ARN of the dataset group to delete.

eventTrackerArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event tracker to delete.

filterArn.Description: The ARN of the filter to delete.

recommenderArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to delete.

schemaArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema to delete.

solutionArn.Description: The ARN of the solution to delete.

algorithmArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the algorithm to describe.

batchInferenceJobArn.Description: The ARN of the batch inference job to describe.

batchSegmentJobArn.Description: The ARN of the batch segment job to describe.

campaignArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.

datasetArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset to describe.

datasetExportJobArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset export job to describe.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group to describe.

datasetImportJobArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset import job to describe.

eventTrackerArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event tracker to describe.

featureTransformationArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the feature transformation to describe.

filterArn.Description: The ARN of the filter to describe.

recipeArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recipe to describe.

recommenderArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to describe.

schemaArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema to retrieve.

solutionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution to describe.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version for which to get metrics.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version from which the batch inference jobs were created.

nextToken.Description: The token to request the next page of results.

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of batch inference job results to return in each page. The default value is 100.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version that the batch segment jobs used to generate batch segments.

nextToken.Description: The token to request the next page of results.

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of batch segment job results to return in each page. The default value is 100.

solutionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution to list the campaigns for. When a solution is not specified, all the campaigns associated with the account are listed.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListCampaigns for getting the next set of campaigns (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of campaigns to return.

datasetArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset to list the dataset export jobs for.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListDatasetExportJobs for getting the next set of dataset export jobs (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of dataset export jobs to return.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListDatasetGroups for getting the next set of dataset groups (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of dataset groups to return.

datasetArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset to list the dataset import jobs for.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListDatasetImportJobs for getting the next set of dataset import jobs (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of dataset import jobs to return.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group that contains the datasets to list.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListDatasetImportJobs for getting the next set of dataset import jobs (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of datasets to return.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The ARN of a dataset group used to filter the response.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListEventTrackers for getting the next set of event trackers (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of event trackers to return.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The ARN of the dataset group that contains the filters.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListFilters for getting the next set of filters (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of filters to return.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListRecipes for getting the next set of recipes (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of recipes to return.

domain.Description: Filters returned recipes by domain for a Domain dataset group. Only recipes (Domain dataset group use cases) for this domain are included in the response. If you don't specify a domain, all recipes are returned.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Domain dataset group to list the recommenders for. When a Domain dataset group is not specified, all the recommenders associated with the account are listed.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListRecommenders for getting the next set of recommenders (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of recommenders to return.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListSchemas for getting the next set of schemas (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of schemas to return.

solutionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListSolutionVersions for getting the next set of solution versions (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of solution versions to return.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group.

nextToken.Description: A token returned from the previous call to ListSolutions for getting the next set of solutions (if they exist).

maxResults.Description: The maximum number of solutions to return.

recommenderArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to start.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to stop.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the solution version you want to stop creating.

tags.Description: Tags to apply to the resource. For more information see Tagging Personalize resources .

tagKeys.Description: Keys to remove from the resource's tags.

campaignArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.

solutionVersionArn.Description: The ARN of a new solution version to deploy.

minProvisionedTPS.Description: Specifies the requested minimum provisioned transactions (recommendations) per second that Amazon Personalize will support.

campaignConfig.Description: The configuration details of a campaign.

recommenderArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to modify.

recommenderConfig.Description: The configuration details of the recommender.

datasetGroupArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset group.

PaginationConfig.Description: A dictionary that provides parameters to control pagination.
